cz.cuni.mff.kocur.world

Class GridSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • cz.cuni.mff.kocur.world.GridSystem
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GridBase, InterestsBase

    public abstract class GridSystem
extends Object
    Abstract class that represents a GridSystem. GridSystem is a coordinate system, that has a origin, resolution and a parent. This class is used to translate coordinates from one base to another.
    Author:
    kocur

        public static Integer[] toTile(double x,
                               double y)
        Parameters:
        x - x
        y - y
        Returns:
        Returns array of x and y tile coordinates.

      • toTile

        public static Integer[] toTile(double[] xy)

      • reverseResolution

        public double reverseResolution(double d)
        Recursively divides x by resolution until it reaches the base. (that will be grid in usual scenario)
        Parameters:
        d - Value to recursively resolve.
        Returns:
        Returns value resolved to base grid system.

      • toBaseResolution

        public double toBaseResolution(double d)
        Recursively multiplies x by resolution until it reaches the base. (that will be grid in usual scenario) For example attack and vision ranges can be resolved using this.
        Parameters:
        d - Value to recursively resolve.
        Returns:
        Returns value resolved to base grid system.

      • toBase

        public double[] toBase(double x,
                       double y)
        Transforms coordinates x, y to base grid system (going through the parents).
        Parameters:
        x - x
        y - y
        Returns:
        Returns passed x, y transformed to base coordinates.

      • toBaseFromParent

        public double[] toBaseFromParent(double x,
                                 double y)

      • toBaseFromParent

        public double[] toBaseFromParent(double[] origin)

      • fromBase

        public double[] fromBase(double x,
                         double y)
        Resolves x, y coordinates from the base to this grid system. Can be used to calculate grid coordinates from the in-game one.
        Parameters:
        x - X coordinate.
        y - Y coordinate.
        Returns:
        Returns grid coordinates, that correspond with x, y from the game and resolutions.

      • fromBaseNoResolution

        public double[] fromBaseNoResolution(double x,
                                     double y)
        Resolves x, y coordinates from base to this coordinates without applying this layer's resolution.
        Parameters:
        x - x
        y - y
        Returns:
        Returns array of ints that correspond to paren't resolution from his base.

      • resolveX

        public double resolveX(double x)
        Resolves x. Transforms it to this base.
        Parameters:
        x - X coordinate you want to resolve. (Should be coordinate in parent system.
        Returns:
        Returns x coordinate with respect to this base.

      • resolveY

        public double resolveY(double y)
        Resolves y. Transforms it to this base.
        Parameters:
        y - y
        Returns:
        Returns resolved y.

                          double y)
        Resolves x, y. Transforms it to this base.
        Parameters:

        y - y
        Returns:

      • centerOfTile

        public double[] centerOfTile(double x,
                             double y)
        Calculates the midpoint of the passed tile coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x - X
        y - Y
        Returns:
        Returns array containing x and y of the midpoint of the tile.

      • getEntityCoordinates

        public double[] getEntityCoordinates(Location e)
        Gets entity coordinates. It applies transformations and resolutions from the parents down to this class. If you use it in system, that has super parent set to GridBase, you can get coordinates from the game to your system.
        Parameters:
        e - Location.
        Returns:
        Returns this system's coordiantes, that correspond to the passed entity.

      • resolveXBack

        public double resolveXBack(double x)
        Resolves the passed x back to the parents system.
        Parameters:
        x - x
        Returns:
        Returns x in parents system coordinates.

      • resolveYBack

        public double resolveYBack(double y)
        Resolves the passed y back to the parents system.
        Parameters:
        y - y
        Returns:
        Returns y in parents system coordinates.

      • resolveXYBack

        public double[] resolveXYBack(double x,
                              double y)
        Resolves the passed x and y back to the parents system.
        Parameters:
        x - x
        y - y
        Returns:
        Returns x [0] and y [1] in parents system coordinates.

      • resolveXYBack

        public double[] resolveXYBack(double[] origin)
        Resolves the passed x and y back to the parents system.
        Parameters:
        origin - Array of coordinates.
        Returns:
        Returns array of x and y in parents system coordinates.

      • areInsideSystem

        public boolean areInsideSystem(double x,
                               double y)
        Checks if two coordinates of parent system are in this system.
        Parameters:
        x - x
        y - y
        Returns:

      • areInside

        public boolean areInside(double x,
                         double y)
        Parameters:
        x - x
        y - y
        Returns:
        Returns true if the two input integers are bigger than 0 and smaller then size of this grid.
